definition: to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect

sentences.english: Have a little compassion on my nerves.
sentences.chinese: 稍许体谅一下我的神经吧。

sentences.english: With the increased contacts will come more understanding and less animosity.
sentences.chinese: 多加交流将可带来体谅，减少敌意。

sentences.english: His Schoolmate Claye is dirty, sly, ever will not forgive others.
sentences.chinese: 他的同学阿克莱肮脏，狡猾，从不会体谅别人。

sentences.english: I also believe those who flaunt their nudity are inconsiderate and selfish.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信那些炫耀他们裸体的人是自私的不体谅人的。

sentences.english: She is senstive to other people's feelings.
sentences.chinese: 她很能体谅他人的感情。

sentences.english: My teacher and Ihave alot of mutual understanding about this problem.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个问题，我和老师能够做到彼此体谅。

sentences.english: So, be an understanding friend and give him some space.
sentences.chinese: 因此，做为朋友要体谅他，留给他一些自由的空间。

sentences.english: Grace for the trials, help from above, Unfailing sympathy, undying love.
sentences.chinese: 试炼得恩助，危难有赖，无限的体谅，不死的爱。

sentences.english: We were so terribly sensitive and considerate back then.
sentences.chinese: 我们那时都很敏感，也都挺体谅人的。

sentences.english: You do not make allowance enough for difference of situation and temper.
sentences.chinese: 你对于各人处境的不同和脾气的不同，体谅得不够。

sentences.english: He treated the boy gently, with consideration.
sentences.chinese: 他对男孩很温和，体谅尊重。

sentences.english: Wolf Larsen was quite considerate , the sailors helped me.
sentences.chinese: 海狼赖生非常体谅我，水手们都帮助我。

sentences.english: Steve's pressure-cooker period lasted much longer than yours, but I am sure you can sympathize.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯的高压期要比你的长的多，相信你可以体谅。
我们必须体谅他还年轻。

sentences.english: Your parets are so proud of you!
sentences.chinese: 我很能体谅你现在的心情。

definition: to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to empathize with/to show solicitude for/T-shirt (loanword)
to cherish/to treasure/to take care of/to love and protect
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to pardon/to forgive/to show tolerance/to contain/to hold/inclusive
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
